meanings.definition: To modulate (a signal) above the normal level.
meanings.sent1: The radio station overmodulated the music, making it sound distorted.
meanings.sent2: He always overmodulated his voice when he got excited, causing feedback on the microphone.
meanings.sent3: The robot overmodulated its speech, leading to some hilarious misunderstandings.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were overmodulated, creating a sense of chaos in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The colors in the painting were overmodulated, giving it a surreal appearance.

meanings.sent1: The sound was overmodulated, making it difficult to understand the words.
meanings.sent2: The overmodulated music was harsh on the ears, causing discomfort to the listeners.
meanings.sent3: The cake was overmodulated with frosting, making it too sweet to eat.
meanings.sent4: Her outfit was overmodulated with bright colors, making her stand out in the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The room was overmodulated with decorations, overwhelming the guests with visual stimuli.
